messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Low self esteem, was balance
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/16/02 4:37:10 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... So, she only read part of the post then responded?   Kind of like responding without knowing
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/16/02 4:37:10 AM Eastern Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

> As to why she agreed that it was handled well after she read Joyces post,
> there was MORE information given that wasn't previously there.
> I also thought HMMMMM, when the poster described needing coffee before
> helping her son, but when she described the very creative way she dealt
> with
> meeting both needs I though "COOL!"
>
> Ren
>

So, she only read part of the post then responded? Kind of like responding
without knowing who you are respondind to? Still sounds like a snap
judgement.

Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Low self esteem, was balance
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/15/02 7:46:46 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/15/02 7:46:46 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Now if Joyce or
Sandry or Ren responds that Yol is a worthy and welcome member, i am sure
you will start kissing Yol's butt like its covered in honey >>

I highly doubt that.
Having met Elissa, I can tell you that she will tell me right to my face if
she disagrees.
She's not a butt kisser in any way....trust me.

As to why she agreed that it was handled well after she read Joyces post,
there was MORE information given that wasn't previously there.
I also thought HMMMMM, when the poster described needing coffee before
helping her son, but when she described the very creative way she dealt with
meeting both needs I though "COOL!"

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
